definition[0]: if goods are produced or bought using a just-in-time system, they are produced or bought just before they are needed so that the company does not have to store things for a long time
definition[1]: if goods are produced or bought using a just-in-time system, they are produced or bought just before they are needed, reducing the cost to the firm of keeping goods for long periods of time
example[1]: The firm is worried that delays could cause problems with their just-in-time manufacturing methods.
example[2]: Many companies are now moving to just-in-time delivery of supplies.
